byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

abstract: Senate's failure to advance legislation on National Security Agency reform highlights discord among Republican leaders; after failing to get extension of federal government's bulk collection of phone records program, Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has found promises he made about Senate’s operation hard to keep.
lead_paragraph: Mitch McConnell has found himself vexed by Democratic delaying tactics he himself honed in the minority, presidential aspirants with their own agendas and conservative firebrands demanding their say.

headline.main: N.S.A. and Other Matters Leave McConnell’s Senate in Disarray
headline.print_headline: Vote on N.S.A. Shows Discord Rules in Senate

snippet: Mitch McConnell has found himself vexed by Democratic delaying tactics he himself honed in the minority, presidential aspirants with their own agendas and conservative firebrands demanding their say.
